CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 14, 1952, pg. 3, reads: "THE REAL McCOY - Little 10-year old Patricia McCoy, who saved her allowance of 25 cents for two weeks so she could join the NAACP, was being lauded this week by workers in NAACP drive here. She is shown with her parents, Mr. and Mrs. James and Rose McCoy and Mrs. Marion Jordon, NAACP executive secretary.  Have you paid your 1952 NAACP membership fee yet? - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Rose and James McCoy standing over their daughter Patricia wearing NAACP pin, with Marion Bond Jordon pointing to document on right, in office
